intro: Vagnera yesoensis, commonly known as the Yeso vine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat succulent. Vagnera yesoensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in warm climates.
